proscene
Class PSAxisPlaneConstraint

java.lang.Object
  proscene.PSConstraint
      proscene.PSAxisPlaneConstraint
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSCameraConstraint, PSLocalConstraint, PSWorldConstraint
public class PSAxisPlaneConstraint
extends PSConstraint

An abstract class for PSFrame PSConstraints defined by an axis or a plane.

PSAxisPlaneConstraint is an interface for (translation and/or rotation) PSConstraint that are defined by a direction. translationConstraintType() and rotationConstraintType() define how this direction should be interpreted: as an axis or as a plane normal.

The three implementations of this class: PSLocalConstraint, PSWorldConstraint and PSCameraConstraint differ by the coordinate system in which this direction is expressed.

Nested Class Summary
static class PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type
          Type lists the different types of translation and rotation constraints that are available.

Constructor Detail

PSAxisPlaneConstraint

public PSAxisPlaneConstraint()
Default constructor.

translationConstraintType() and rotationConstraintType() are set to PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FREE. translationConstraintDirection() and rotationConstraintDirection() are set to (0,0,0).

Method Detail

translationConstraintType

public PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type translationConstraintType()
Returns the translation constraint Type.

Depending on this value, the PSFrame will freely translate (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FREE), will only be able to translate along an axis direction (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.AXIS), will be forced to stay into a plane (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.PLANE) or will not able to translate at all (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FORBIDDEN).

Use PSFrame.setPosition(PVector) to define the position of the constrained PSFrame before it gets constrained.

translationConstraintDirection

public processing.core.PVector translationConstraintDirection()
Returns the direction used by the translation constraint.

It represents the axis direction (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.AXIS) or the plane normal (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.PLANE) depending on the translationConstraintType(). It is undefined for (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FREE) or (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FORBIDDEN).

The PSAxisPlaneConstraint derived classes express this direction in different coordinate system (camera for PSCameraConstraint, local for PSLocalConstraint, and world for PSWorldConstraint). This value can be modified with setRotationConstraintDirection(PVector).

rotationConstraintType

public PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type rotationConstraintType()
Returns the rotation constraint Type.

rotationConstraintDirection

public processing.core.PVector rotationConstraintDirection()
Returns the axis direction used by the rotation constraint.

This direction is defined only when rotationConstraintType() is PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.AXIS.

The PSAxisPlaneConstraint derived classes express this direction in different coordinate system (camera for PSCameraConstraint, local for PSLocalConstraint, and world for PSWorldConstraint). This value can be modified with setRotationConstraintDirection(PVector).

setTranslationConstraint

public void setTranslationConstraint(PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type type,
                                     processing.core.PVector direction)
Simply calls setTranslationConstraintType(Type) and setTranslationConstraintDirection(PVector).

setTranslationConstraintDirection

public void setTranslationConstraintDirection(processing.core.PVector direction)
Defines the translationConstraintDirection(). The coordinate system where direction is expressed depends on your class implementation.

setRotationConstraint

public void setRotationConstraint(PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type type,
                                  processing.core.PVector direction)
Simply calls setRotationConstraintType(Type) and setRotationConstraintDirection(PVector).

setRotationConstraintDirection

public void setRotationConstraintDirection(processing.core.PVector direction)
Defines the rotationConstraintDirection(). The coordinate system where direction is expressed depends on your class implementation.

setTranslationConstraintType

public void setTranslationConstraintType(PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type type)
Sets the Type() of the translationConstraintType(). Default is PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FREE

setRotationConstraintType

public void setRotationConstraintType(PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type type)
Set the Type of the rotationConstraintType(). Default is PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FREE.

Depending on this value, the PSFrame will freely rotate (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FREE), will only be able to rotate around an axis (PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.AXIS), or will not able to rotate at all PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.FORBIDDEN.

Use PSFrame.setOrientation(PSQuaternion) to define the orientation of the constrained PSFrame before it gets constrained.

Attention: An PSAxisPlaneConstraint.Type.PLANE Type is not meaningful for rotational constraints and will be ignored.
